definitions.definition: One pulsation of the heart ; especially an irregular one, hence the emotion which causes it.
examples: The policeman waited for a heartbeat in vain.
He alone gives me such heartbeats .

definitions.definition: The rhythm at which a heart pulsates, a cardiac indicator.
examples: If your heartbeat doesn't normalize soon, consult a doctor!

definitions.definition: A driving impulse or vital force ; the vital center of something.
examples: Music is the heartbeat of the people.

definitions.definition: A very short space of time ; an instant .
examples: The ambulance arrived in a heartbeat .

definitions.definition: A periodic signal generated by hardware or software to indicate normal operation or to synchronize other parts of a system .

main_definition: One pulsation of the heart ; especially an irregular one, hence the emotion which causes it.
secondary_definitions: The rhythm at which a heart pulsates, a cardiac indicator.
A driving impulse or vital force ; the vital center of something.
A very short space of time ; an instant .
( computing ) A periodic signal generated by hardware or software to indicate normal operation or to synchronize other parts of a system .
